after: Nicodemus figures prominently in medieval depictions of the Deposition in which he, and Joseph of Arimathea are shown removing the dead Christ from the cross, often with the aid of a ladder.

Like Joseph, Nicodemus became the object of various pious legends during the Middle Ages, particularly in connection with monumental crosses. He was reputed to have carved both the Holy Face of Lucca and the BatllÃ³ Crucifix, receiving angelic assistance with the face in particular and thus rendering the works instances of acheiropoieta.[3]
